artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Sasaki Toyokichi; Carver: Wada Yūjirō
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 509.9; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), fig. 225, p. 276.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: figure with angry face, red-tinted eyes and green-tinted skin, emerging from a swirling grey vortex with yellow cloud; figure wear white headband, white and grey armor, and a tan kimono with dark orange swirl designs; figure reaches down with outstretched PR hand, with fingers spread
markings: Artist’s seal: 芳年之印 {Yoshitoshi no in} | Carver’s seal: 和田刀 {Wada tō}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Collection of Thirty-six Ghosts in New Style (Shinkei sanjūrokkaisen 新形三十六怪撰)
title: Akugenda Yoshihira’s Ghost Attacking Nanba Jirō at the Nunobiki Waterfall
